<rule id="configuration-management-0100" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="spring-cloud-config-client" groupId="org.springframework.cloud"/>
                    </project>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="spring-cloud-starter-config" groupId="org.springframework.cloud"/>
                    </project>
                    <dependency artifactId="spring-cloud-config-client" groupId="org.springframework.cloud"/>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="information" effort="0" title="Embedded library - Spring Cloud Config">
                    <message>
                        The application embeds Spring Cloud Config.

                        If you are migrating to Azure Spring Apps, the connection info of Config Server will be injected automatically upon app start.
                        Find any explicit configurations of config server connection info:

                        If configured in **configuration files**: they will be ignored and overrided by Azure Spring Apps.

                        If configured in **command line parameters**, **Java system attribute**, **environment variable**: they need to be removed or you might experience conflicts and unexpected behavior.

                        Configure the config server after creating an Azure Spring Apps instance.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/developer/java/migration/migrate-spring-cloud-to-azure-spring-apps?pivots=sc-standard-tier#prepare-the-spring-cloud-config-server" title="Prepare the Spring Cloud Config server"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Spring Cloud Config</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
